newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH STATS BUREAU TO CUT 97 GDP GROWTH FCAST- CTK.
newsitem.headline: CZECH STATS BUREAU TO CUT 97 GDP GROWTH FCAST- CTK.

text.p: The Czech Statistical Bureau (CSU) will probably cut its 1997 gross domestic product (GDP) growth forecast to as low as 2.7 percent from its original forecast of 4-5 percent, Czech news agency CTK said on Friday.

The CSU's vice president Ivan Sujan told CTK that Prime Minister Vaclav Klaus's halving of the government's original 5.4 percent growth forecast on Wednesday would "probably be the lower limit (of the adjusted forecast)."
In announcing a package of measures on Wednesday to revitalise the flagging Czech economy Prime Minister Klaus said he would regard it as a "success" if growth reached 2.7 percent in 1997.
Sujan said the CSU would put out a new official forecast on May 2. He added that he expected real first quarter GDP growth of between 1.0 and 1.5 percent.
Last year, economic growth fell to 4.4 percent from 4.8 percent in 1995.
